alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 2:39PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 238 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Raton Pass, or 14 miles west of Raton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton and Raton Pass. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 448 and 451, and between Mile Markers 454 and 460. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 339 and 342. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
